metadata.name: Detect Virtualbox Driver Installation OR Starting Of VMs
metadata.comment: Adversaries can carry out malicious operations using a virtual instance to avoid detection. This rule is built to detect the registration of the Virtualbox driver or start of a Virtualbox VM.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('vboxrt.dll,rtr3init')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('vboxc.dll')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('vboxdrv.sys')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('startvm')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('controlvm'))))

output.summary: Adversaries can carry out malicious operations using a virtual instance to avoid detection. This rule is built to detect the registration of the Virtualbox driver or start of a Virtualbox VM.

metadata.objective: Examine fields: ComputerName, actor.user.name, process.cmd_line, process.parent_process.cmd_line False positive: This may have false positives on hosts where Virtualbox is legitimately being used for operations References: https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2020/05/21/ragnar-locker-ransomware-deploys-virtual-machine-to-dodge-security/, https://threatpost.com/maze-ransomware-ragnar-locker-virtual-machine/159350/
